sentence.Network_en: Light colours provide an effective backdrop for pictures or a mirror.
sentence.Network_cn: 浅色是挂放图画或镜子很有效果的衬托。

sentence.Network_en: The profits rise was achieved against a backdrop of falling metal prices.
sentence.Network_cn: 在金属价格下跌的背景下，利润提高了。

sentence.Network_en: The mountains provided a dramatic backdrop for our picnic.
sentence.Network_cn: 群山如画，给我们的野餐平添景色。

entry.tran: （挂在舞台后部的）彩画幕布，背景幕布
entry.def: A backdrop is a large piece of cloth, often with scenery painted on it, that is hung at the back of a stage while a play is being performed.
The backdrop to an object or a scene is what you see behind it.

example.ex: Leeds Castle will provide a dramatic backdrop to a fireworks display next Saturday...
example.tran: 利兹堡将为下周六的烟花燃放提供美妙的背景衬托。

example.ex: Light colours provide an effective backdrop for pictures or a mirror.
example.tran: 浅色是挂放图画或镜子很有效果的衬托。

entry.def: The backdrop to an event is the general situation in which it happens.

example.ex: The election will take place against a backdrop of increasing instability.
example.tran: 选举将在愈加动荡不安的局势下举行。

means.word_mean: 1. scenery hung at back of stage

sentences.en: A storm-tossed ship was painted on the backdrop for the first act of the modern drama named Pirate.
sentences.cn: 名为《海盗》的话剧第1幕的背景幕布上画的是颠簸于惊涛骇浪中的一条船。

sentences.en: The large bay has a superb backdrop of mountains.
sentences.cn: 大海湾背靠着庄严的山脉。

sentences.en: It is a love story set against a backdrop of rural Irish life.
sentences.cn: 这是一个以爱尔兰乡村生活为背景的爱情故事。

sentences.en: The World War Ⅱ provided the backdrop for the film.
sentences.cn: 这部影片以二战为背景。

sentences.en: War is more than just a dramatic backdrop to the novel.
sentences.cn: 战争对这部小说来说不仅仅是个跌宕起伏的背景。

sentences.en: The Alps provided the perfect backdrop for a romantic holiday.
sentences.cn: 在阿尔卑斯山过一个浪漫的假日真是再完美不过了。

sentences.en: The conference begins this week against a backdrop of unmitigated gloom.
sentences.cn: 会议这个星期在一片愁云惨雾中开始。
